page.title: 10FARMS
page.content: The farms in the area are mainly big and are mostly individually owned and extensively farmed to grow mainly wheat, barley and hay. They also grow smaller quantities of potatoes, beans and peas. Most farms have a great deal of machinery and do not need to employ many people. They take on extra employees at harvest time in summer. They do not have many animals, just a few for their own use and pleasure. Some have dogs for hunting and shooting pigeons, rabbits, pheasants and ducks. Fox hunting is not the same as they ride horses wearing special clothes and the dogs kill the fox when it is cornered. There is a vet in the village who looks after the animals.
